title: Display face on "Cuba and the Cuban Railroad" vintage poster
content:
[Cuban Poster](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201101215/http:/i6.photobucket.com/albums/y246/joshoakley/cuba_poster.jpg)

Anyone know what the display typeface at top is? Anything similar would be great too. Thanks!

 [‹ The Teaching of the Epistle to the Hebrews serif face on spine of old book](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201101215/http:/typophile.com/node/48034 "Go to previous forum topic") ["Entertainment" wide square techno sans ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201101215/http:/typophile.com/node/48049 "Go to next forum topic")
author: FeeltheKern

comments.content: Is this a vintage poster? Do you know when this is from?

It’s a poster from the book “Cuba Style: Graphics from the Golden Age of Design.” Didn’t know if someone out there had digitized this typeface, or if there’s even anything similar. I looked on Letterhead fonts, thinking this would be my most likely source, but to no avail.

Closest I can think of would be Epitaph, digitized by Jonathan Smith as [Gyptienne](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201101215/http:/www.dafont.com/gyptienne.font?text=CUBA), and a mix of characters from the regular and alternate fonts of [Quaint Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20081201101215/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/spiecegraphics/quaint-gothic-sg/).
